newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: TNT Express Asia-Pac half-yr up 148 pct.
newsitem.headline: TNT Express Asia-Pac half-yr up 148 pct.

text.p: Express distribution company TNT Express Worldwide (TNT) on Wednesday said profits rose 148 percent for the six months to December 31, 1996.
It said in a statement the gain, against the same period of the previous year, was after absorbing costs of Asia Air Network operations.
TNT is a wholly-owned unit of Dutch postal and telecommunications group Koninklijke PTT Nederland.
The company declined to give any detailed figures, but said the outlook for 1997 was good.
Substantial growth in contributions from operations in the Philippines, Indonesia and Korea were major factors in profitability, it said.
TNT said it planned to open three new depots in Malaysia and Indonesia later this year, and would expand its China network from nine to 14 depots during 1997.
It also planned a major expansion of operations in Vietnam.
